verses.kjv: Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, lest at any time we should let them slip.
verses.ct: That is why we must pay even closer attention to what we have been taught, so that we don't drift away from it.

verses.kjv: For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward;
verses.ct: After all, if the message delivered through angels proved binding, and every violation and act of disobedience received its fair punishment,

verses.kjv: How shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heard him;
verses.ct: how will we escape if we ignore such an incredible salvation? This salvation was first announced by the Lord himself, and then it was confirmed to us by those who personally heard him.

verses.kjv: God also bearing them witness, both with signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will?
verses.ct: God also backed up their testimony with signs, wonders, various miracles, and gifts of the Holy Spirit distributed according to his own will.

verses.kjv: For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.
verses.ct: Now, it is not to angels that God has given authority over the coming world we are talking about.

verses.kjv: But one in a certain place testified, saying, What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou visitest him?
verses.ct: Instead, someone declared in Scripture, 'What are human beings that you think about them? What is a son of man that you care for him?

verses.kjv: Thou madest him a little lower than the angels; thou crownedst him with glory and honour, and didst set him over the works of thy hands:
verses.ct: You made him a little lower than the angels; you crowned him with glory and honor and placed him in charge of everything your hands have made.

verses.kjv: Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing that is not put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.
verses.ct: You put everything under his authority.' When God placed everything under his authority, he left nothing outside of it. Yet right now, we do not see everything under his authority.

verses.kjv: But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.
verses.ct: But we do see Jesus — who was made a little lower than the angels so that he could suffer death — now crowned with glory and honor, because by God's grace he experienced death on behalf of everyone.

verses.kjv: For it became him, for whom are all things, and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
verses.ct: It was fitting that God, for whom and through whom everything exists, would make the pioneer of their salvation perfect through suffering as he brought many sons and daughters to glory.

verses.kjv: For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified are all of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,
verses.ct: The one who makes people holy and those who are being made holy all share the same origin. That is why he is not ashamed to call them brothers and sisters,

verses.kjv: Saying, I will declare thy name unto my brethren, in the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.
verses.ct: saying, 'I will proclaim your name to my brothers and sisters; in the middle of the congregation I will sing your praises.'

verses.kjv: And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.
verses.ct: He also says, 'I will place my trust in him.' And again, 'Here I am, together with the children God has given me.'

verses.kjv: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;
verses.ct: Since those children share in flesh and blood, he himself also fully shared in the same, so that through his death he could destroy the one who holds the power of death — that is, the devil —

verses.kjv: And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.
verses.ct: and set free all those who lived their entire lives enslaved by their terror of dying.

verses.kjv: For verily he took not on him the nature of angels; but he took on him the seed of Abraham.
verses.ct: Clearly, it is not angels he reaches out to help, but the descendants of Abraham.

verses.kjv: Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto his brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.
verses.ct: For this reason, he had to be made like his brothers and sisters in every way, so that he could become a merciful and faithful high priest in service to God, making atonement for the sins of the people.

verses.kjv: For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.
verses.ct: Because he himself suffered when he was tested, he is able to help those who are going through testing.
